code:
def is_prime?(num)
  return false if num <= 1
  
  (2..Math.sqrt(num)).each do |i|
    return false if num % i == 0
  end
  
  true
end

final_answer(answer: "Ruby function to check if a number is prime")
raw_response:
Thought: Implement a method that checks divisibility of the input number from 2 up to its square root, returning false if any divisor is found. If no divisors are found after this range, the number is prime.

```ruby
def is_prime?(num)
  return false if num <= 1
  
  (2..Math.sqrt(num)).each do |i|
    return false if num % i == 0
  end
  
  true
end

final_answer(answer: "Ruby function to check if a number is prime")
```
